title: Lag Issues in Telia & Riotdirect
body:
So recently we have been experiencing lag issues. Have look at these trace-routes to riot's internal network from intermediate hops. First hops are excluded as it has nothing to do with internal routing issues.

>   8   238 ms   237 ms   239 ms  ldn-b1-link.telia.net [213.248.72.137]
>   9   252 ms   245 ms   243 ms  ldn-bb3-link.telia.net [62.115.115.16]
>  10    [*]     258 ms    [*]    nyk-bb3-link.telia.net [80.91.248.203]
>  11   262 ms   279 ms   290 ms  chi-b21-link.telia.net [62.115.116.33]
>  12   423 ms   428 ms   327 ms  riot-ic-315569-chi-b21.c.telia.net [62.115.63.66]
>  13   271 ms   271 ms   260 ms  104.160.131.60
>  14   461 ms   336 ms   555 ms  ae30-br01.sea01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.11]
> 
>  15   449 ms   453 ms   476 ms  xe-0-1-2-br01.pdx02.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.2]
>  16   458 ms   427 ms   428 ms  104.160.128.101
>  17   506 ms   327 ms   407 ms  192.64.174.69
> 
> Trace complete.

From Hop 10 EU server packet drops occur. From hop 11 Europe server  till internal we can see +100ms spikes. It's not us players who are actually lagging but it's peering issue. I will be sending same data to each party regarding the issue, hope it can be solved with proper networking.

replies.body:
Thanks for the heads up on this.  Based on what I see here, the initial info might be really important in case your own router could be having issues.  I only suggest this because your ping is pretty high from the start.  Unless your ping is pretty low at the start, then disregard of course.

I also recommend running a traceroute from [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) instead for a few minutes, it makes what's happening much easier to read.  

We can do our best to offer assistance as well, but we may be unable to do a lot if the ISP is not part of the list of [Peering Partners.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/210665503-NA-Peering-Partners)

The information is much appreciated, will keep an eye out in case other players around your region are having similar issues.
i know its kinda old thread, but just let me tell you, i have had 10 telia routers in different locations, no difference whatsoever still same shit lag

as I stated TeliaSonera is in fact part of Riot's Peer, I hope they fix the routing issue. We have been experiencing lag issues since last month, before that routes were going through 'Level3' but were much smooth. 
I'm working on notifying each peer that is lagging through.
My outgoing peer is Bharti Airtel which initially lags 156ms which should be around 50ms but overall as I said internal routing also lags which I should be reporting here. After Country's initial peer the log is available for you to diagnose as it's relevant. 

Reason for reporting log is to direct point exact Top level peers connected in communication. As you guys can now diagnose proper intermediate Routers.** As far as Initial routers are concerned** I assure you it has nothing to do with the lag caused by TeliaSonera and RiotDirect routers. Since these route doubles the ping, game is pretty unplayable, still I'm working on reporting each peer about issues starting from ISP to each intermediate peer.
